page.title: 19Netherton
page.content: Mr.Lay farms the land around Netherton. He grows 750 acres of barley,maize, sugar beet,turnips and 300 acres of grassland for sheep and cattle. There are also fields of pigs owned by the Pig Improvement Company which is based near by. Most houses in the village are made from Cotswold stone with brick corners for strength.There are many dry-stone walls.These are built by hand without cement.In the garden of the old farm- house are 8 brick beehives.Baskets can be placed on each platform for hives. Openings to the front and rear allow easy access to the garden flowers. The village and farm have changed little over the last 200 years.Only machinery has changed.40 years ago Mr.Beck ploughed the land with a team of horses.He ploughed 1 acre of land a day.Now tractors and combines do it.
